c74object.name: the.snapshot~
c74object.digest: Sotre running MSP audio on a videoframe-basis
c74object.description:
Written by Tim Heinze Â© 2020, www.xenorama.com.
Synchronised to a parent render context of the.jit.renderer~, stores realtime MSP audio to read from during an offline render process.
Replace any snapshot~ controlling video frames by this object.
c74object.discussion:
the.jit.renderer~ providing a central context is required in the enviroment.
Replace any snapshot~ controlling video frames by this object. As opposed to snapshot~, it does not natively support a fixed 'interval' and the active flag pertains to the attribute used commonly among objects in the Oneirotomy-package. If a fixed rate was previously specified and is still desired, the resulting data from snapshot~ can be further routed through the queue and/or finally captured by the.cerebellum instead.

objarg.name: ctx
objarg.digest: Specify a valid render context for all children objects to sync to
objarg.description: As of Version 2.0 the ctx-name must match that of a jit.world present in the patch. It is necessary to provide a context name for all members of the offline render family to sync and respond to.

objarg.name: reporting-interval
objarg.description: Set the reporting interval in ms or using the Max time format syntax. If the interval is 0 snapshot~ will only output data when it receives a bang message.

attribute.name: active
attribute.description:
Set the active flag. There are 5 active states available suitable for different purposes:
0 = ignore this object and pass everything through without recording or recalling
1 = operate normally (default); playback, record and output during rendering
2 = playback and output previously recorded data normally but do not record any new data
3 = playback and record normally but do not output data during rendering
4 = record and output during rendering but never pass incoming data
5 = mute all activity
Note that while recording is disabled, the automatic export upon recording completion (if an exportname is specified) is also disabled and previous files will not be overwritten.
Furthermore, the active flag is overriden by the solo state of the object, which can be handled using the queue method.

attribute.name: automatic
attribute.description:
Sync output to framerate. When enabled will output data on every frame. During recording, the fps-clock is raised to high priority and no longer bound to the actual current framerate, useful for tight timing.
This setting will automatically flagged when interval is explicity specified and the internal clock will be overriden.
The default is 0 (disabled)

attribute.name: units
attribute.value: ms hh:mm:ss ticks bars.beats.units notevalues hz samples

attribute.name: mode
attribute.description:
Three modes of signal capturing are available:
snapshot (default): report any incoming signal data, behaviour of snapshot~ supporting all its native attributes as well.
peakamp: report the maximum signal value since the last report, behaviour of peakamp~. See also the signed attribute relevant in this mode and note that native snapshot~ attributes are not supported.
avg: report the average (absolute) signal amplitude of the input signal, behaviour of avg~ and likewise only supports manual or automatic bangs.

attribute.name: signed
attribute.description: When mode is 'peakamp' and the signed attribute is set to 1, the peak amplitude of the incoming signal in the specified interval is reported, rather than the absolute value of the peak amplitude.

method.name: int
method.description:
In left inlet: Any non-zero value turns on interval-based reporting, 0 turns it off. Reporting is on by default if a non-zero interval was specified.
In right inlet: Set the reporting interval in ms. If the interval is 0, automatic reporting stops.

method.name: float
method.description:
In left inlet: Any non-zero value turns on interval-based reporting, 0 turns it off. Reporting is on by default if a non-zero interval was specified.
In right inlet: Set the reporting interval in ms. If the interval is 0, automatic reporting stops.

method.name: list
method.digest: Set interval in Max time format.

method.name: anything
method.digest: Set interval in Max time format.

method.name: offset
method.digest: Set sample vector offset of value reported
method.description: Set the index of the sample within a signal vector that will be reported. The number is constrained between 0 (least recent, the default) and the current signal vector size minus one (most recent).

method.name: sampleinterval
method.digest: Set interval in samples per sampleinterval

method.name: signal
method.description:
In single-channel mode, converts current signal value to a float and outputs as a float message, or during a frame-by-frame render process.
In mc mode (the.mc.snapshot~), left outlet outputs float message for each channel in sequence. The right outlet outputs a corresponding voice message in the format: voice channel-number.

method.name: trash
method.digest: Delete all data files from disk which have been recorded
method.description:
The message trash will delete all recorded files from disk which had previously been written in the current session by this instance.
This action cannot be undone and no confirmation will be demanded. The respective files are deleted permanently from disk.
